item.title: Remembering the Casbah: A Vintage Vegas Story of Intrigue & Reinvention
item.description:
A Desert Oasis of Intrigue: The Casbah’s Early Years

Few Las Vegas landmarks have a history as colorful and complex as the Casbah Hotel and Casino. Opened in 1963 by the ambitious Danny Jackson, the Casbah aimed to transport visitors to a Moroccan fantasy. Located on the Strip (originally at Sahara Avenue, now the site of Las Vegas City Hall), it was designed to evoke the exotic atmosphere of North Africa, with lush landscaping, ornate fountains, and a distinctive architecture. Jackson envisioned a sophisticated, upscale experience, distinct from the other casinos of the time. While initially successful, the Casbahâ€™s reputation quickly began to tarnish.
